title: Starmer suggests UK will play role in Gaza aid air drops

content:

title: Trump and golf - striking balls and deals over 18 holes
description: For some US presidents, golf was a break from work - but for Trump, visiting Scotland this weekend, it is anything but.
content:
Mick Mulvaney thought he had beaten Donald Trump. The president and his White House chief of staff were playing golf at Trump's Bedminster club in 2019, and Mulvaney was up by one stroke with three holes left.

title: Gregg Wallace: Ex-MasterChef host 'sorry' but says he's 'not a groper'
description: The former presenter was sacked after 45 allegations against him were upheld by a review.
content:
Last week, Wallace's co-host Torode was sacked after an allegation of using a severely offensive racist term was upheld.
BBC News has since revealed that the alleged incident took place on the set of MasterChef in 2018.

title: West Ham’s Lucas Paquetá expected to be cleared of spot-fixing over bookings
description: The Brazilian player was accused of picking up yellow cards deliberately but is expected to be found not guilty
content: Lucas Paquetá is expected to learn in the coming days that he has been cleared of spot-fixing, removing a shadow that has hung over him for two years and stood to wreck his career. The 27-year-old West Ham midfielder faced a lengthy ban after being c... [3290 chars]

title: ‘Dodgy guys who dress just like him’: meet the team behind far-right activist Tommy Robinson
description: Stephen Yaxley-Lennon may appear to be a one-man band, but behind him is a colourful inner circle helping to pull the strings of the far right
content:
The Tommy Robinson outriders were early to Epping. Wendell Daniel, a former Labour councillor who is now a film-maker for Robinson’s Urban Scoop video platform, turned his microphone to a young woman on the edge of the protests in the Essex town.
